subject: Career
title: Documentation as Communication
description: A micro-lesson that makes Documentation as Communication usable.

hook.text: The answer exists. It's in someone's head. They're on vacation. Now the project is blocked for a week.

buildup.text: Undocumented knowledge is organizational risk. When people leave, so does their knowledge.

discovery.text: Good documentation scales you: it answers questions when you're not available, forever.

twist.text: Most documentation fails because it's written once and never updated. Living docs beat perfect docs.

climax.text: Write docs for your future self who has forgotten everything. If that person can follow it, anyone can.

punchline.text: If it's not documented, it didn't happen â€” and it won't happen again.

quiz.question: Why is documentation critical in workplace communication?
options: It scales knowledge and prevents project blocks when people are unavailable
